Key Match Events: The game came down to the final moments
Donte DiVincenzo hit a crucial free throw that ultimately sealed the victory
Wembanyama finished with 34 points on 30 shots in the loss
The Spurs held a 90-82 lead early in the fourth, but Naz Reid, Julius Randle and DiVincenzo sparked a comeback for Minnesota
Post-Match Reflections: Wembanyama finished with 34 points on 30 shots in the loss, while Harrison Barnes and Devin Vassell added 23 and 22 points, respectively.

DiVincenzo led Minnesota with 26 points, while Rudy Gobert contributed 17 points and 15 rebounds. Julius Randle chipped in 16 points, Anthony Edwards scored 14 points and Jaden McDaniels had 12 points and 10 rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Minnesota Timberwolves held off the gritty San Antonio Spurs on Sunday, securing their third consecutive win with a 112-110 victory at Target Center in Minneapolis.
The Spurs built a 33-25 lead in the first quarter, but the Timberwolves dominated the second quarter 32-12.
The Spurs shot just 34.1% in the first half and trailed 57-45 at halftime.
Others: The Spurs' rally in the third quarter was led by Wembanyama, Devin Vassell and Keldon Johnson, where they outscored the Timberwolves by 12 points.
